answers.answer: I'm having a section due to other medical issues including previous section and my bubs weighed over 5 at my 32 week ultrasound... Don't forget ultrasounds can be off by up to a pound so your bubs could be the average 3.5lb baby. Also my aunt is super tiny and had a 10.5lb baby 3 years ago with no medical assistance.

I had vaginal deliveries for both my boys.... oldest was 8lb 4.5oz and my youngest was 9lb 12.8oz. (I also did not have gestational diabetes...which I get asked all the time). Talk to your Dr about your concerns. My doctor had complete confidence I could deliver a big baby. I actually just talked to her about this current pregnancy b/c typically each baby gets bigger... lol We really are much stronger than sometimes we give ourselves credit for. I hope you have an awesome doctor or mw that'll encourage you. :-) and fyi... there is a margin of error on u/s up to two pounds either way, so baby may not be as big as you think. :-)
I wish i knew last time i had a ultrasound i was 22w im now 33.

Im 31weeks n 4days I went Monday and got my growth ultrasound done and my baby girl is measuring 4lbs and shes measuring at 34weeks I also wanted to know if my baby will b bigger then my last child. My first son was 7lbs 5oz, second son was 6lbs 9oz, and my last son was 8lbs 15oz and im pregnant wit my first girl....

My son measured 6 days ahead at 29 weeks and now, at 31 weeks, everything is on pace. He weighs 3.74 lbs and still measures in the 90th percentile for growth. My ob said he should 'even out' but there has been zero talk of a c section. They should be discussing that around 36 weeks in my opinion. I think it's too soon to know now.

question: Went for my growth ultrasound yesterday and they said she weighs 4 pounds 11ounces and she is measuring a week ahead..im 32 weeks and not due till sept 7 but m worried now about how big she will be by then n really dont want to have a csection...can u gus tell me what your babies weigh n if u are having a c section..thanks
title: big baby...
